turns.content:
Web search results:

[1] "How the COE open bidding system works Calculation of COE Quota Premium COE bidding procedure 1. Have sufficient funds in your bank account 2. Format of bidder ID 3. Indicate your reserve price 4. Pay bid deposit and administration fee 5. Receive your Acknowledgement Code Where to submit your bid"
Source: https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home/buying/upfront-vehicle-costs/certificate-of-entitlement--coe-.html

[2] "With 2018 finally behind us, we decided to look at COE prices across the year. Cat A and B fell by around S$11,000, ending at S$25,501 and $31,001. For Cat E, it fell by more than $15,000, ending at $31,809. While that has happened for various reasons, we learned that it is unwise to spot and predict future Certificate of Entitlement (COE) prices."
Source: https://www.motorist.sg/article/330/11-factors-that-would-affect-coe-price-in-2019

[3] "Industry watchers expect COE prices to keep rising, possibly till 2023, after open category premiums hit S$99,999 Aaron Low/TODAY Cars on display at a showroom along Jalan Bukit Merah on..."
Source: https://www.todayonline.com/singapore/industry-watchers-expect-coe-prices-keep-rising-possibly-till-2023-after-open-category-premiums-hit-s99999-1867986

[4] "The five categories for COEs are A, B, C, D and E. Without going into too much detail: A and B are for passenger cars; C is for goods vehicles and buses; D is for motorcycles; and E is for any. What affects COE prices? There have been some changes to the distinction between Cat A and Cat B over the years, and this has had some impact in the prices."
Source: https://crystalballanalytics.wixsite.com/main/predicting-coe

[5] "Prices for all the COE categories rose except for the small cars category. The COE price for Category B cars, which are bigger and more powerful, rose almost one per cent to a record $113,000...."
Source: https://sg.news.yahoo.com/coe-prices-big-car-open-categories-surge-091900530.html

[6] "Once COE prices are in print, keep in mind that its yesterdays news, in a sense, because it reflects the market behaviour of the round that just passed. As with any normal market situation, prices go up and demand goes down, or vice versa. Generally speaking, if COE prices have gone up this round, they will likely go down on the next."
Source: https://carbuyer.com.sg/2022-carbuyer-easy-guide-to-certificates-of-entitlement-coe/

[7] "Open Category COEs can be used for any vehicle type but end up being used mainly for large cars. Premiums rose by nearly 6 per cent in the latest tender, up from S$104,400 two weeks ago."
Source: https://www.channelnewsasia.com/singapore/coe-prices-record-open-category-cars-end-higher-bidding-results-jul-6-2791846

[8] "COE premium for Open Category hits new high of S$114,001 as prices rise across the board Motorists drive along the Central Expressway in Singapore on Jun 4, 2020. (File photo: AFP/Roslan Rahman)"
Source: https://www.channelnewsasia.com/singapore/coe-prices-record-open-category-cars-jul-20-2822721

[9] "NUMBERS AT A GLANCE: Cat A (Cars up to 1,600cc 97kW or fully electric cars with output of up to 110kW): S$87,235 (up from S$81,089) Cat B (Cars above 1,600cc or 97kW or fully electric cars with..."
Source: https://www.todayonline.com/singapore/coe-prices-hit-record-highs-motorcycle-large-car-open-categories-2040946

[10] "COE prices rise across the board, with Open category reaching new high of $114,001. SINGAPORE - Certificate of entitlement (COE) premiums ended higher in all categories at the latest tender ..."
Source: https://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/transport/coe-prices-rise-across-the-board-with-open-category-setting-record-twice-in-a-row-at-114k
Current date: 1/19/2023
Instructions: Using the provided web search results, write a comprehensive reply to the given prompt. Make sure to cite results using [[number](URL)] notation after the reference. If the provided search results refer to multiple subjects with the same name, write separate answers for each subject.
Prompt: how can we satisfactorily predict COE prices for the Open Category

It is difficult to satisfactorily predict COE prices for the Open Category, as the prices are determined through open bidding exercises conducted twice a month, and the price can fluctuate based on the demand. According to [[2](https://www.motorist.sg/article/330/11-factors-that-would-affect-coe-price-in-2019)], industry watchers expect COE prices to keep rising, possibly till 2023, after open category premiums hit S$99,999. However, as [[6](https://carbuyer.com.sg/2022-carbuyer-easy-guide-to-certificates-of-entitlement-coe/)], states once COE prices are in print, it is yesterday's news, and prices may change depending on the market behavior of the round that just passed. In general, if COE prices have gone up this round, they will likely go down on the next.
